page.title: 12KETTLEWELL PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school has just celebrated its Centenary. Built half a mile outside the village by local subscription after disagreements with the church, it had a young headmaster who gave many years of dedicated service, with original ideas in an independent tradition continued today. 24 pupils come to the school today, a clearly visible limestone landmark on the road to Starbotton. They all stay for dinner, which is cooked in the kitchen - 6 infant boys, 8 junior girls and 10 junior boys. 12 come from Kettlewell, the others by bus from Starbotton, Buckden, Raisgill, Oughtershaw and Greenfield. It is staffed by one headteacher, an infant teacher, a part-time teacher, music teacher for 2 hours per week and a clerical non-teaching assistant.
